metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Legal and Regulatory Risks/
aws::graph::propositions: Tax Obligations and Risks for Online Marketplaces
New obligations include withholding or collecting sales taxes on online marketplaces.
New obligations include withholding or collecting consumption taxes on online marketplaces.
New obligations include withholding or collecting value added taxes on online marketplaces.
New obligations include withholding or collecting taxes on remote sellers.
New obligations may result in liability for third party tax obligations.
Non-U.S. jurisdictions have proposed taxes on online advertising revenues.
Non-U.S. jurisdictions have proposed taxes on marketplace service revenues.
Non-U.S. jurisdictions have enacted taxes on online advertising revenues.
Non-U.S. jurisdictions have enacted taxes on marketplace service revenues.
Unilateral tax measures may continue to proliferate unless broader international tax reform is implemented.
The European Union has enacted global minimum taxes.
Other countries have enacted global minimum taxes.
Some countries have committed to enact global minimum taxes.
Global minimum taxes may increase tax expenses.
Additional taxes imposed prospectively could adversely affect results of operations.
Additional taxes imposed retroactively could adversely affect results of operations.
Additional taxes imposed prospectively could adversely affect cash flows.
Additional taxes imposed retroactively could adversely affect cash flows.
Additional taxes resulting from failure to comply with collection obligations could adversely affect results of operations.
Additional penalties resulting from failure to comply with collection obligations could adversely affect results of operations.
Additional taxes resulting from failure to provide information about customers for tax reporting purposes could adversely affect results of operations.
Additional taxes resulting from failure to provide information about suppliers for tax reporting purposes could adversely affect results of operations.
Additional taxes resulting from failure to provide information about third parties for tax reporting purposes could adversely affect results of operations.
Information about customers must be provided to various government agencies for tax reporting purposes.
Information about suppliers must be provided to various government agencies for tax reporting purposes.
Information about third parties must be provided to various government agencies for tax reporting purposes.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Legal and Regulatory Risks/
/FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Legal and Regulatory Risks/

text:
These include new obligations to withhold or collect sales, consumption, value added, or other taxes on online marketplaces and remote sellers, or other requirements that may result in liability for third party obligations. For example, non-U.S. jurisdictions have proposed or enacted taxes on online advertising and marketplace service revenues. Proliferation of these or similar unilateral tax measures may continue unless broader international tax reform is implemented. In addition, the European Union and other countries (including those in which we operate) have enacted or have committed to enact global minimum taxes, which may increase our tax expense.

Our results of operations and cash flows could be adversely affected by additional taxes imposed on us prospectively or retroactively or additional taxes or penalties resulting from the failure to comply with any collection obligations or failure to provide information about our customers, suppliers, and other third parties for tax reporting purposes to various government agencies.
